description.narrative: An Accountable Entity's, the Millennium Challenge Account (MCA) Lesotho, administrative costs, which include staff salaries; Accountable Entity facilities; IT software, hardware and support; fiscal and procurement agent costs; audit costs; and general overhead costs.

condition.narrative: (a) All applicable conditions precedent in the PIA have been duly satisfied, deferred or waived as provided in the PIA.

(b) No material default or breach of any covenant, obligation or responsibility by the Government, MCA-Lesotho or any Government entity has occurred and is continuing under the PIA, the Compact or any Supplemental Agreement.
(c) Activities to be funded with MCC funding being requested by the initial Disbursement Request will not violate any applicable law or regulation.

(d) The Implementation Plan Documents submitted to MCC are current and updated and are in form and substance satisfactory to MCC, and there has been satisfactory progress on the components of the Implementation Plan for any relevant Projects or Project activities related to the initial Disbursement.

(e) There has been satisfactory progress on the M&E Plan for the Program, relevant Project or Project activity and substantial compliance with the requirements of such M&E Plan (including the targets set forth therein (except for the targets specified in Schedule 2 to the PIA, which will require compliance to the extent specified in Schedule 2) and any applicable reporting requirements set forth therein for the initial Disbursement Period).

(f) There has been no material negative finding in any financial audit report delivered in accordance with the Compact and Audit Plan, for the prior two quarters (or such other period as the Audit Plan may require).

(g) Any Taxes paid with MCC funding through the date 90 days prior to the start of the initial Disbursement Period have been reimbursed by the Government in full in accordance with Section 1.2(b)(ix) of the PIA.

(h) The Government has satisfied all of its payment obligations, including any insurance, indemnification, tax payments or other obligations, and contributed all resources required from it, under the Compact, the PIA and any Supplemental Agreement.

(i) MCC does not have grounds for concluding that any matter certified to it in the related MCA-Lesotho Initial Disbursement Certificate, the Fiscal Agent Disbursement Certificate, or the Procurement Agent Disbursement Certificate is not as certified.

(j) MCC has not determined that an act, omission, condition, or event has occurred that would be the basis for MCC to suspend or terminate, in whole or in part, MCC funding in accordance with Section 5.1 of the Compact
Certain, identified quantitative targets of key monitoring and evaluation indicators measuring and evaluating progress toward achievement of the Compact Goal and Objectives must be met.

Delivery of a certificate of MCA-Lesotho, substantially in the form of the "MCA Initial Disbursement Certificate" provided by MCC, dated as of the date of Disbursement, together with the attachments thereto. The certificate will certify the following items:
Delivery of a certificate of the Fiscal Agent, substantially in the form of the "Fiscal Agent Disbursement Certificate" provided by MCC.
Delivery of a certificate of the Procurement Agent, substantially in the form of the "Procurement Agent Disbursement Certificate" provided by MCC.

Each of the key officers for MCA-Lesotho identified in Annex I Section A.4.of the Compact [and the social/gender specialist] has been selected and engaged by MCA-Lesotho and approved by MCC and remains engaged by MCA-Lesotho or, in the case of a vacant position in connection with any of the key officers [or the social/gender specialist] MCA-Lesotho is actively engaged in the recruitment and selection of an individual to fill such vacancy.

If required by any activity, MCA-Lesotho will obtain and have on file all required environmental and other licenses and permits as required by the National Environment Act of 2001 and any future amendments, validly issued and in full effect, necessary to perform each Project or Project Activity.

MCA-Lesotho has delivered to MCC a written request in the form of the "Form of Disbursement Request" provided by MCC. MCA-Lesotho has delivered to NBC a completed CPS Payment Request Form, the form of which shall be provided by MCC.
MCA-Lesotho has delivered to MCC any reports then due from any technical (including environmental) auditors engaged by MCA-Lesotho for any Project activity.

MCA-Lesotho has delivered to MCC the Periodic Reports in connection with the related Disbursement Period. * Narrative Report * Quarterly Financial Report Procurement * Performance Report * CP Report * Indicator Tracking Table
MCA-Lesotho will complete an environmental audit of all Project Activities in each of years 3 and 5 of the Compact.
MCA-Lesotho will ensure that a Social/Gender Specialist is hired and remains engaged throughout the length of the Compact, or in the event the position is vacant, MCA-Lesotho is actively recruiting.

The social/gender specialist will (1) develop a gender integration plan that includes (a) approaches for meaningful and inclusive consultations with women and other vulnerable/underrepresented groups through the life of the Compact; (b) Project-specific gender analyses, as appropriate; and (c) strategies for incorporating findings of the gender analyses into final Project activity designs; and (2) ensure that final Project activity designs are consistent with and incorporate the outcomes of the gender integration plan.

usg:usg-activity.usg:purpose-statement: An Accountable Entity's, the Millennium Challenge Account (MCA) Lesotho, administrative costs, which include staff salaries; Accountable Entity facilities; IT software, hardware and support; fiscal and procurement agent costs; audit costs; and general overhead costs.
